alert.note: Alert for Bay; Calhoun; Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued January 09 at 9:25AM EST until January 09 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northern Gulf County in the Panhandle of Florida... Southeastern Bay County in the Panhandle of Florida... South central Calhoun County in the Panhandle of Florida... Southwestern Liberty County in Big Bend Florida... * Until 1000 AM EST/900 AM CST/. * At 925 AM EST/825 AM CST/, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Mexico Beach, or 13 miles northwest of Port St. Joe, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Mexico Beach and Tyndall Air Force Base around 830 AM CST. Wewahitchka around 840 AM CST. Stonemill Creek around 845 AM CST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Honeyville, Allanton, Chipola Cutoff, Wewahitchka, Orange, Red Hill, Overstreet, Marysville, Estiffanulga, and Kern. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. This cluster of thunderstorms is capable of producing tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
